p: Dichloromethane extracts of E. abyssinica, S. pinnata, and T. diversifolia (leaves) exhibited high antiplasmodial activity (IC 50 ≤ 10 μg/ml) while those of T. brownii, Z. chalybeum, T. diversifolia (flower), S. didymobotrya (leaves), and S. africana exhibited moderate antiplasmodial activity (IC 50 of 11-50 μg/ml) against the two strains of P. falciparum. However, S. didymobotrya (pods) and C. edulis exhibited low antiplasmodial activity (IC 50 of 50-100 μg/ml) while L. mollissima extracts were inactive (IC 50 ≥ 100 μg/ml) against the two strains of P. falciparum ( Table 2)
